Pre-Game Insights: Lionel Messi is not selected in the Argentina squad due to an ankle injury.
Alexis Mac Allister is 'in pain' and unlikely to feature against Chile.
Nicolas Tagliafico and Leonardo Balerdi are ruled out through injury.
Angel Di Maria and Franco Armani have both retired from international football.
Others: Enzo Fernandez was in the headlines for all the wrong reasons last month after he was captured singing an offensive song about French players following Argentina's Copa America triumph, but he is available for selection and could start in midfield.

Nahuel Molina and Gonzalo Montiel will resume their battle for a start at right-back, while Cristian Romero and Lisandro Martinez is set to be the preferred centre-back partnership, protecting first-choice goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez.

Enzo Fernandez, Leandro Paredes, Guido Rodriguez, Nicolas Gonzalez, Alejandro Garnacho, Paulo Dybala, Valentin Castellanos, Giuliano Simeone, Matias Soule, and Ezequiel Fernandez will be among those pushing to start, while uncapped quartet Valentin Castellanos, Giuliano Simeone, Matias Soule, and Ezequiel Fernandez will also be hoping to feature in some capacity on Thursday.
